snippet: The most detailed description to date of the C.I.A.’s role in the Benghazi attack told of security officers racing on foot from a secret base in the city to the American diplomatic mission.
abstract: Central Intelligence Agency senior officials describe pivotal role CIA security officers played in combating militants who attacked American diplomatic mission in Benghazi, Libya, on September 11; CIA officers deployed rescue party from secret base in city, sent reinforcements from Tripoli and organized armed Libyan military convoy to escort surviving Americans to planes that whisked them out of country.
lead_paragraph: The most detailed description to date of the C.I.A.’s role in the Benghazi attack told of security officers racing on foot from a secret base in the city to the American diplomatic mission.

headline.seo: C.I.A. Played Major Defensive Role in Libya Attack
headline.main: C.I.A. Played Major Role Fighting Militants in Libya Attack
headline.print_headline: C.I.A. Played Major Role Fighting Militants in Libya Attack
